channel.title: Last resort
channel.description:
Okay, after days of finding stuff to hide a process. I come down to one last resort.
How to hide it from processes, not using C++ but with another language. It must be possible to hide it from the ctrl + alt + del right?

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

zstars:

you should simply forget the idea, because nobody likes rootkits

Pretty much because /. told them to.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

To hide a program from user level windows you would need to use a rootkit. If it is for a legitimate project, you should simply forget the idea, because nobody likes rootkits, and people who care enough (who are the ones that would hack your game anyway) can bypass them with relative ease. If it is for an unlegit project, you should probably forget it all too.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Efilite:

How do I hide a program from processes.

don’t start it

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188

@Zach1188 wrote:

You don’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

it is always possible to dll inject using the appinit_dlls registry key, which isnt really injection, just loads any dll into all processes
i dont think you will get a good answer on this forum as theres not many people here who know about the internals of windows

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Efilite, post:23, topic:253783”][quote author=qauters link=topic=335262.msg2612716#msg2612716 date=1230843159]

he wants to stop other applications form accessing the process “Gunz.exe” and inject dlls into it, if he disables taskmanager the injecting programs can still get the tasklist.

Ooohh, well that’s even harder. Because someone making a .dll injector is likely coding at kernel level as well.

dll injection is piss easy.

Anyway, if I understand what nueb35 says, then it’s impossible. Removing your process from the tasklist doesn’t prevent other programs to inject.
They only way to see if somebody injected, is too scan your program for an unknown dll. However this wouldn’t stop normal code injection (injection without an dll).
Scanning other processes to see if it contains an handle to yours, doesn’t seem functional as well.
[/quote]
Dll injection can’t be easy when you can’t find the process to inject it into.[/quote]'Sif hiding it from the task manager will do shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @Efilite Efilite
item.description:
@Efilite wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:13, topic:253783”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=335262.msg2610912#msg2610912 date=1230766391]

he wants to stop other applications form accessing the process “Gunz.exe” and inject dlls into it, if he disables taskmanager the injecting programs can still get the tasklist.

Ooohh, well that’s even harder. Because someone making a .dll injector is likely coding at kernel level as well.
[/quote]
dll injection is piss easy.

Anyway, if I understand what nueb35 says, then it’s impossible. Removing your process from the tasklist doesn’t prevent other programs to inject.
They only way to see if somebody injected, is too scan your program for an unknown dll. However this wouldn’t stop normal code injection (injection without an dll).
Scanning other processes to see if it contains an handle to yours, doesn’t seem functional as well.[/quote]
Dll injection can’t be easy when you can’t find the process to inject it into.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

ur best bet would be to disallow other processes from calling openprocess on ur process, but im not sure how u would do that

and then theres shit like cheat engine that run in kernel level and theres no way to block something like CE from injecting a dll

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Of course not, but that’s not what yakman was saying at all. See, there’s too different topics going on here, we at first thought he wanted to hide his program from task manager or disable it entirely, which he didn’t.

Besides, disabling cmd, taskmanager, and regedit would not protect you from .dll injection at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:19, topic:253783”]I know, but the registry values he is speaking of are independent from Gunz.

They would all be disable regardless of what server you went to o.O[/quote]
No, he meant nobody wants to play a game which forces the client to disable cmd etc.
If the game would crash, the keys wouldn’t be reverted, which means you fucked up his pc.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @maggot525 maggot525
item.description:
@maggot525 wrote:

frank_:

didnt gunz have its own anticheat that didnt work

Yep.

@OP: Even if you hide the process people could still hack it. People can modify the .mrs files.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:10, topic:253783”][quote author=nueb35 link=topic=335262.msg2610817#msg2610817 date=1230762984]
he wants to stop other applications form accessing the process “Gunz.exe” and inject dlls into it, if he disables taskmanager the injecting programs can still get the tasklist.
[/quote]
Ooohh, well that’s even harder. Because someone making a .dll injector is likely coding at kernel level as well.[/quote]
dll injection is piss easy.

Anyway, if I understand what nueb35 says, then it’s impossible. Removing your process from the tasklist doesn’t prevent other programs to inject.
They only way to see if somebody injected, is too scan your program for an unknown dll. However this wouldn’t stop normal code injection (injection without an dll).
Scanning other processes to see if it contains an handle to yours, doesn’t seem functional as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Mopman:

Do you mean the process list, or the task list/application list? The latter is easy, the former requires some code running at kernel level like yakman said (not hard, just install it when your app launches)

If I’m not mistaken, in C++ your application doesn’t show up in the application list at all by default. But I also don’t know win32 API well, or it may depend on the compiler. Removing it from the process list is pretty tricky, and a google search most likely wont help you. You pretty much have to learn C++ well and figure it out.

[quote=“Pwnd, post:7, topic:253783”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=335262.msg2609681#msg2609681 date=1230712086]
Your best bet would be to keep task manager from opening altogether.

HWND TaskManager;

while(true) {
    TaskManager = FindWindow(NULL, "Windows Task Manager");
    if(TaskMager != NULL) {
        PostMessage(TaskManager, WM_CLOSE, (LPARAM)0, (WPARAM)0);
    }
    Sleep(500); //To reduce CPU load
}

[/quote]That screams hax, but if that’s what he’s looking for, then meh l0l[/quote]
Its 100% obvious, if your task manager only flashes on your screen for an instant. But its quite crippling if you disable command prompt and regedit the same way, and if you know how to make it start in safemode as well

Edit: While I’m here, C++ is probably the way to go for this sort of thing, so changing languages will send u back a bit. Except maybe assembly, but you’re on your own with that one.

Read full topic

item.title: Last resort
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:5, topic:253783”]Your best bet would be to keep task manager from opening altogether.

[code]
HWND TaskManager;

while(true) {
TaskManager = FindWindow(NULL, “Windows Task Manager”);
if(TaskMager != NULL) {
PostMessage(TaskManager, WM_CLOSE, (LPARAM)0, (WPARAM)0);
}
Sleep(500); //To reduce CPU load
}
[/code][/quote]That screams hax, but if that’s what he’s looking for, then meh l0l

Read full topic
